account.externalId.description: Sets the account to be credited when payment is received via credit card. The undepFunds field must be set to FALSE in order to set this field.
account.externalId.name: account.externalId

account.internalId.description: Sets the account to be credited when payment is received via credit card. The undepFunds field must be set to FALSE in order to set this field.
account.internalId.name: account.internalId

account.name.description: Sets the account to be credited when payment is received via credit card. The undepFunds field must be set to FALSE in order to set this field.
account.name.name: account.name

altHandlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.
altHandlingCost.name: altHandlingCost

altShippingCost.description: This is a read-only field that returns the shipping costs based on the shipping method selected in shipMethod.
altShippingCost.name: altShippingCost

authCode.description: Sets the authorization code for the transaction. If you have a NetSuite merchant account, then this field autofills with the authorization code as soon as the charge is approved. If you do not have a NetSuite merchant account, enter the authorization code you receive when the charge to the customer's credit card is validated outside of NetSuite, such as by a card-swipe terminal.
authCode.name: authCode

billAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.externalId.name: billAddressList.externalId

billAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.internalId.name: billAddressList.internalId

billAddressList.name.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.name.name: billAddressList.name

ccApproved.description: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.
ccApproved.name: ccApproved

ccAvsStreetMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.Possible values include _Y, _N _X.The possible values include:_Y � The address information submitted did match._N � The address information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.
ccAvsStreetMatch.value.name: ccAvsStreetMatch.value

ccAvsZipMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.Possible values include _Y, _N _X.The possible values include:_Y � The address information submitted did match._N � The address information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned to VeriSign.If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.
ccAvsZipMatch.value.name: ccAvsZipMatch.value

ccExpireDate.description: Sets the credit card expiration date.
ccExpireDate.name: ccExpireDate

ccIsPurchaseCardBin.description: This box is marked when NetSuite determines that the credit card entered is a purchase card. If you use the Send Purchase Card Data feature and the Process as Purchase Card box is also checked, this credit card payment will be processed by NetSuite as a purchase card.Contact your NetSuite account representative for more information.
ccIsPurchaseCardBin.name: ccIsPurchaseCardBin

ccName.description: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.
ccName.name: ccName

ccNumber.description: Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.On a get, this value is masked.When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.
ccNumber.name: ccNumber

ccProcessAsPurchaseCard.description: This box is checked when NetSuite has determined that the credit card entered is a purchase card. You can clear this box if you need to process this payment as a Level I payment transaction.If NetSuite does not recognize the credit card entered as a purchase card but you want to process it as one, check this box.
ccProcessAsPurchaseCard.name: ccProcessAsPurchaseCard

ccSecurityCode.description: Enter the three-digit card security code from the back of the customer's credit card.
ccSecurityCode.name: ccSecurityCode

ccSecurityCodeMatch.value.description: This field shows the Card Security Code (CSC) result code returned to VeriSign when a credit card transaction takes place.The possible codes are:   1. Y - The code submitted did match.   2. N - The code submitted did not match.   3. X - The credit card company does not support CSC, or no information was returned to VeriSign.
ccSecurityCodeMatch.value.name: ccSecurityCodeMatch.value

ccStreet.description: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.
ccStreet.name: ccStreet

ccZipCode.description: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.
ccZipCode.name: ccZipCode

chargeIt.description: If payment is by credit card, place a check mark in this box to process the credit card charge over the Internet. The effect is the same as swiping a card through a terminal. Funds will move if the card is accepted. If rejected, you will be told why. You must have previously set up a NetSuite merchant account for this to work.
chargeIt.name: chargeIt

createdFrom.externalId.description: This field reference the Sales Order the current Cash Sales record is associated with.
createdFrom.externalId.name: createdFrom.externalId

createdFrom.internalId.description: This field reference the Sales Order the current Cash Sales record is associated with.
createdFrom.internalId.name: createdFrom.internalId

createdFrom.name.description: This field reference the Sales Order the current Cash Sales record is associated with.
createdFrom.name.name: createdFrom.name

creditCard.externalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.externalId.name: creditCard.externalId

creditCard.internalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.internalId.name: creditCard.internalId

creditCard.name.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.name.name: creditCard.name

creditCardProcessor.externalId.description: Select a credit card processor. For details about credit card processors, click Help and read Setting Up Credit Card Gateways in NetSuite.
creditCardProcessor.externalId.name: creditCardProcessor.externalId

creditCardProcessor.internalId.description: Select a credit card processor. For details about credit card processors, click Help and read Setting Up Credit Card Gateways in NetSuite.
creditCardProcessor.internalId.name: creditCardProcessor.internalId

creditCardProcessor.name.description: Select a credit card processor. For details about credit card processors, click Help and read Setting Up Credit Card Gateways in NetSuite.
creditCardProcessor.name.name: creditCardProcessor.name

currency.externalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customForm.externalId.description: If you customized a sales receipt form, select it here, or click New to customize a new sales receipt form.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: If you customized a sales receipt form, select it here, or click New to customize a new sales receipt form.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: If you customized a sales receipt form, select it here, or click New to customize a new sales receipt form.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

debitCardIssueNo.description: Sets the debit card authorization number for UK accounts only. The debit card authorization number is printed on the card. Required for users of SecPay or WorldPay.
debitCardIssueNo.name: debitCardIssueNo

deferredRevenue.description: Deferred Revenue:amount of revenue deferred on this transaction
deferredRevenue.name: deferredRevenue

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.name.name: department.name

discountItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.externalId.name: discountItem.externalId

discountItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.internalId.name: discountItem.internalId

discountItem.name.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.name.name: discountItem.name

discountRate.description: If the value entered here includes the percent sign, the discount rate applied to the item is calculated as a percent. If the value entered here does not include the percent sign, the discount rate is applied as an absolute discount value.For example, 10% would result in a ten percent discount on the item whereas 10 would result in a ten dollar discount on the item.
discountRate.name: discountRate

discountTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the amount discounted on this cash sale.
discountTotal.name: discountTotal

endDate.description: Sets the date for the last cash sale. This should only be set if Advanced Billing is being used. If a cash sale is created from a sales order that includes an End Date, this field autofills on the cash sale when the order is billed.
endDate.name: endDate

entity.externalId.description: Sets the customer this cash sale is associated with. Required on Add.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: Sets the customer this cash sale is associated with. Required on Add.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: Sets the customer this cash sale is associated with. Required on Add.
entity.name.name: entity.name

entityTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - External id
entityTaxRegNum.externalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.externalId

entityTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
entityTaxRegNum.internalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.internalId

estGrossProfit.description: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfit.name: estGrossProfit

estGrossProfitPercent.description: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfitPercent.name: estGrossProfitPercent

exchangeRate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the Customer set in the entity field.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

excludeCommission.description: Check this option to exclude this transaction and its subordinate transactions from inclusion in all commission calculations.
excludeCommission.name: excludeCommission

expCostDiscAmount.description: The amount added to or taken away from the total shows here, based on what is selected in the Discount/Markup field.
expCostDiscAmount.name: expCostDiscAmount

expCostDiscRate.description: The rate of the discount or markup item selected shows here.This rate is applied to the billable expenses you select and calculated in the total for the cash sale.
expCostDiscRate.name: expCostDiscRate

expCostDiscTaxable.description: Place a check mark in this box if these expenses are taxable.
expCostDiscTaxable.name: expCostDiscTaxable

expCostDiscount.externalId.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable expenses applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
expCostDiscount.externalId.name: expCostDiscount.externalId

expCostDiscount.internalId.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable expenses applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
expCostDiscount.internalId.name: expCostDiscount.internalId

expCostDiscount.name.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable expenses applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
expCostDiscount.name.name: expCostDiscount.name

expCostDiscprint.description: Check this box if you added a discount or markup to expenses and want to print it on the invoice.
expCostDiscprint.name: expCostDiscprint

expCostTaxCode.externalId.description: If expenses should be taxed, select the default tax code for all expenses.If expenses should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual expenses in the list below.
expCostTaxCode.externalId.name: expCostTaxCode.externalId

expCostTaxCode.internalId.description: If expenses should be taxed, select the default tax code for all expenses.If expenses should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual expenses in the list below.
expCostTaxCode.internalId.name: expCostTaxCode.internalId

expCostTaxCode.name.description: If expenses should be taxed, select the default tax code for all expenses.If expenses should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual expenses in the list below.
expCostTaxCode.name.name: expCostTaxCode.name

expCostTaxRate1.description: The tax rate of the code selected shows here.
expCostTaxRate1.name: expCostTaxRate1

fob.description: Sets the location where the customers technically acquire ownership.
fob.name: fob

handlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.To change the cost of handling, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_SHIPITEM_> > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.
handlingCost.name: handlingCost

handlingTax1Rate.description: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.
handlingTax1Rate.name: handlingTax1Rate

handlingTaxCode.externalId.description: Select the tax code that determines the tax for handling charges.
handlingTaxCode.externalId.name: handlingTaxCode.externalId

handlingTaxCode.internalId.description: Select the tax code that determines the tax for handling charges.
handlingTaxCode.internalId.name: handlingTaxCode.internalId

handlingTaxCode.name.description: Select the tax code that determines the tax for handling charges.
handlingTaxCode.name.name: handlingTaxCode.name

ignoreAvs.description: Check the Ignore AVS box to ignore the results of the Address Verification System (AVS) pre-authorization check. If you choose to ignore the AVS check, when a customer's address information does not match the billing address of the credit card account, then Cybersource still processes the payment.
ignoreAvs.name: ignoreAvs

isRecurringPayment.description: This box is checked if this cash sale was generated from a sales order for a recurring payment.Payments marked as recurring can be successfully processed even if the credit card expires during the billing schedule.You should not check this box for standalone cash sales. You should only check this box for transactions with recurring payments. It can be used for cash sale sales orders with billing schedules or memorized cash sale sales order.
isRecurringPayment.name: isRecurringPayment

isTaxable.description: If set to true, the entire invoice is taxable.
isTaxable.name: isTaxable

itemCostDiscAmount.description: The amount added to or taken away from the total shows here, based on what is selected in the Discount/Markup field.
itemCostDiscAmount.name: itemCostDiscAmount

itemCostDiscPrint.description: Check this box if you added a discount or markup and want to print it on the invoice.
itemCostDiscPrint.name: itemCostDiscPrint

itemCostDiscRate.description: The rate of the discount or markup item selected shows here.This rate is applied to the billable items you select and calculated in the total for the cash sale.
itemCostDiscRate.name: itemCostDiscRate

itemCostDiscTaxable.description: Check the Apply Before Tax box to apply the markup to the price before you charge taxes. This applies to every billable item on the sale.
itemCostDiscTaxable.name: itemCostDiscTaxable

itemCostDiscount.externalId.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable items applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
itemCostDiscount.externalId.name: itemCostDiscount.externalId

itemCostDiscount.internalId.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable items applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
itemCostDiscount.internalId.name: itemCostDiscount.internalId

itemCostDiscount.name.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable items applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
itemCostDiscount.name.name: itemCostDiscount.name

itemCostTaxCode.externalId.description: If items should be taxed, select the default tax code for all items.If items should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual items in the list below.
itemCostTaxCode.externalId.name: itemCostTaxCode.externalId

itemCostTaxCode.internalId.description: If items should be taxed, select the default tax code for all items.If items should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual items in the list below.
itemCostTaxCode.internalId.name: itemCostTaxCode.internalId

itemCostTaxCode.name.description: If items should be taxed, select the default tax code for all items.If items should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual items in the list below.
itemCostTaxCode.name.name: itemCostTaxCode.name

itemCostTaxRate1.description: The tax rate of the code selected shows here.
itemCostTaxRate1.name: itemCostTaxRate1

job.externalId.description: When the Consolidate Jobs on Sales Transactions preference is enabled, the job field appears as a body field and as a line item field.
job.externalId.name: job.externalId

job.internalId.description: When the Consolidate Jobs on Sales Transactions preference is enabled, the job field appears as a body field and as a line item field.
job.internalId.name: job.internalId

job.name.description: When the Consolidate Jobs on Sales Transactions preference is enabled, the job field appears as a body field and as a line item field.
job.name.name: job.name

leadSource.externalId.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.
leadSource.externalId.name: leadSource.externalId

leadSource.internalId.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.
leadSource.internalId.name: leadSource.internalId

leadSource.name.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.
leadSource.name.name: leadSource.name

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: Enter a memo to describe this cash sale. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Undeposited Funds register.
memo.name: memo

message.description: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.
message.name: message

messageSel.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.
messageSel.externalId.name: messageSel.externalId

messageSel.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.
messageSel.internalId.name: messageSel.internalId

messageSel.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.
messageSel.name.name: messageSel.name

nexus.externalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.externalId.name: nexus.externalId

nexus.internalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.internalId.name: nexus.internalId

nexus.name.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.name.name: nexus.name

opportunity.externalId.description: References all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity.
opportunity.externalId.name: opportunity.externalId

opportunity.internalId.description: References all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity.
opportunity.internalId.name: opportunity.internalId

opportunity.name.description: References all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity.
opportunity.name.name: opportunity.name

otherRefNum.description: Sets the customer PO number associated with the current invoice.
otherRefNum.name: otherRefNum

partner.externalId.description: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.
partner.externalId.name: partner.externalId

partner.internalId.description: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.
partner.internalId.name: partner.internalId

partner.name.description: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.
partner.name.name: partner.name

paymentMethod.externalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.. This value sets the type of card.
paymentMethod.externalId.name: paymentMethod.externalId

paymentMethod.internalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.. This value sets the type of card.
paymentMethod.internalId.name: paymentMethod.internalId

paymentMethod.name.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists.. This value sets the type of card.
paymentMethod.name.name: paymentMethod.name

pnRefNum.description: If you accept credit card payments, the Verisign authentication code appears here once the payment is approved.
pnRefNum.name: pnRefNum

postingPeriod.externalId.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.
postingPeriod.externalId.name: postingPeriod.externalId

postingPeriod.internalId.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.
postingPeriod.internalId.name: postingPeriod.internalId

postingPeriod.name.description: Required on Add when the Accounting Periods feature is enabled. Defaults to the current posting period.
postingPeriod.name.name: postingPeriod.name

promoCode.externalId.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction.  In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. Note that validation of promotion code date range for a cash sale transaction generated from a sales order is different for Web services vs. the user interface.  In the user interface as long as sales order date was within the promotion code date range, cash sale can be generated without error, even if cash sale date is outside of promotion code date range.  In Web services, cash sale date must be within promotion code date range.
promoCode.externalId.name: promoCode.externalId

promoCode.internalId.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction.  In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. Note that validation of promotion code date range for a cash sale transaction generated from a sales order is different for Web services vs. the user interface.  In the user interface as long as sales order date was within the promotion code date range, cash sale can be generated without error, even if cash sale date is outside of promotion code date range.  In Web services, cash sale date must be within promotion code date range.
promoCode.internalId.name: promoCode.internalId

promoCode.name.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction.  In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. Note that validation of promotion code date range for a cash sale transaction generated from a sales order is different for Web services vs. the user interface.  In the user interface as long as sales order date was within the promotion code date range, cash sale can be generated without error, even if cash sale date is outside of promotion code date range.  In Web services, cash sale date must be within promotion code date range.
promoCode.name.name: promoCode.name

recognizedRevenue.description: Recognized Revenue:cumulative amount of revenue recognized for this transaction
recognizedRevenue.name: recognizedRevenue

revRecOnRevCommitment.description: Check this check box to create a Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.    * On a Sales Order, the Revenue Commitment replaces an invoice    * On a Return Authorization, the Revenue Commitment Reversal replaces a credit memo.NetSuite creates all applicable Revenue Recognition schedules for the Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.
revRecOnRevCommitment.name: revRecOnRevCommitment

revenueStatus.value.description: The possible values for this field are:   1. Pending: indicates that no recognition has occurred. All revenue is still deferred.   2. In Progress: indicates that some recognition has occurred.   3. Completed: indicates that all recognition has occurred. No deferred revenue remains.
revenueStatus.value.name: revenueStatus.value

salesEffectiveDate.description: You can change the sales effective date for this transaction.The sales effective date determines which commission plan and historical sales team this transaction applies to.
salesEffectiveDate.name: salesEffectiveDate

salesGroup.externalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.externalId.name: salesGroup.externalId

salesGroup.internalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.internalId.name: salesGroup.internalId

salesGroup.name.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.name.name: salesGroup.name

salesRep.externalId.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the CashSaleSalesTeamList list.
salesRep.externalId.name: salesRep.externalId

salesRep.internalId.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the CashSaleSalesTeamList list.
salesRep.internalId.name: salesRep.internalId

salesRep.name.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the CashSaleSalesTeamList list.
salesRep.name.name: salesRep.name

shipAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.externalId.name: shipAddressList.externalId

shipAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.internalId.name: shipAddressList.internalId

shipAddressList.name.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.name.name: shipAddressList.name

shipDate.description: Sets the ship date for this transaction.
shipDate.name: shipDate

shipMethod.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.
shipMethod.externalId.name: shipMethod.externalId

shipMethod.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.
shipMethod.internalId.name: shipMethod.internalId

shipMethod.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.
shipMethod.name.name: shipMethod.name

shippingCost.description: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Item.
shippingCost.name: shippingCost

shippingTax1Rate.description: The tax rate for this tax code is shown here.
shippingTax1Rate.name: shippingTax1Rate

shippingTaxCode.externalId.description: Select the tax code that determines the tax charged for shipping.
shippingTaxCode.externalId.name: shippingTaxCode.externalId

shippingTaxCode.internalId.description: Select the tax code that determines the tax charged for shipping.
shippingTaxCode.internalId.name: shippingTaxCode.internalId

shippingTaxCode.name.description: Select the tax code that determines the tax charged for shipping.
shippingTaxCode.name.name: shippingTaxCode.name

startDate.description: Sets the date for creating the first bill. This should only be set if Advanced Billing is being used.
startDate.name: startDate

subTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.
subTotal.name: subTotal

subsidiary.externalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - External id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncPartnerTeams.name: syncPartnerTeams

syncSalesTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncSalesTeams.name: syncSalesTeams

tax2Total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the PST tax in Canadian Accounts.
tax2Total.name: tax2Total

taxDetailsOverride.description: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.
taxDetailsOverride.name: taxDetailsOverride

taxItem.externalId.description: A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this sale. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this sale, select another tax item.To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.
taxItem.externalId.name: taxItem.externalId

taxItem.internalId.description: A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this sale. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this sale, select another tax item.To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.
taxItem.internalId.name: taxItem.internalId

taxItem.name.description: A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this sale. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this sale, select another tax item.To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.
taxItem.name.name: taxItem.name

taxRate.description: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. You can change it here for just this transaction if you wish.
taxRate.name: taxRate

taxRegOverride.description: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.
taxRegOverride.name: taxRegOverride

taxTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the result of the tax rate multiplied by the taxable total of line items for the transaction.
taxTotal.name: taxTotal

timeDiscAmount.description: The amount added to or taken away from the total shows here, based on what is selected in the Discount/Markup field.
timeDiscAmount.name: timeDiscAmount

timeDiscPrint.description: Check this box if you added a discount or markup and want to print it on the invoice.
timeDiscPrint.name: timeDiscPrint

timeDiscRate.description: The rate of the discount or markup item selected shows here.This rate is applied to the billable time you select and calculated in the total for the cash sale.
timeDiscRate.name: timeDiscRate

timeDiscTaxable.description: Check this box if the discount or markup item selected should be applied to the billable time you select before taxes are calculated for the cash sale.
timeDiscTaxable.name: timeDiscTaxable

timeDiscount.externalId.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable time applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
timeDiscount.externalId.name: timeDiscount.externalId

timeDiscount.internalId.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable time applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
timeDiscount.internalId.name: timeDiscount.internalId

timeDiscount.name.description: Select a discount or markup item to apply to billable time applied to this cash sale.The rate of discount or markup automatically fills in the Rate field and is calculated in the Total.
timeDiscount.name.name: timeDiscount.name

timeTaxCode.externalId.description: If time should be taxed, select the default tax code for all time entries.If time should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual time entries in the list below.
timeTaxCode.externalId.name: timeTaxCode.externalId

timeTaxCode.internalId.description: If time should be taxed, select the default tax code for all time entries.If time should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual time entries in the list below.
timeTaxCode.internalId.name: timeTaxCode.internalId

timeTaxCode.name.description: If time should be taxed, select the default tax code for all time entries.If time should not be taxed, select -Not Taxable-.You can edit individual time entries in the list below.
timeTaxCode.name.name: timeTaxCode.name

timeTaxRate1.description: The tax rate of the code selected shows here.
timeTaxRate1.name: timeTaxRate1

toBeEmailed.description: Causes the Cash Sale to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.
toBeEmailed.name: toBeEmailed

toBeFaxed.description: Causes the Cash Sale to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.
toBeFaxed.name: toBeFaxed

toBePrinted.description: If enabled, this Cash Sale is saved in a queue of invoices that can be printed at a later date.
toBePrinted.name: toBePrinted

total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.
total.name: total

totalCostEstimate.description: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.
totalCostEstimate.name: totalCostEstimate

trackingNumbers.description: Sets the shipping tracking number from the shipping company.
trackingNumbers.name: trackingNumbers

tranDate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: Defaults to the largest Cash Sale number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.
tranId.name: tranId

tranIsVsoeBundle.description: Check this box to include all items added to this transaction as a VSOE bundle.
tranIsVsoeBundle.name: tranIsVsoeBundle

type.value.description: Sets the account to be credited when payment is received via credit card. The undepFunds field must be set to FALSE in order to set this field.
type.value.name: type.value

undepFunds.description: Set to TRUE if you receive payment by cash or check. If set to FALSE, set an account in the account field.
undepFunds.name: undepFunds

validFrom.description: Enter the date when this card first became valid. Use the format MM/YYYY.
validFrom.name: validFrom

vsoeAutoCalc.description: The VSOE allocation amount for a sale can be calculated automatically by checking the Auto Calculate VSOE Allocation box. Allocation is the process to determine the VSOE price for items on a sale. The total VSOE amount allocated is the revenue amount to be recognized for the bundle.
vsoeAutoCalc.name: vsoeAutoCalc
